intro: Lemboglossum stellatum, commonly known as the star-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Lemboglossum stellatum is well adapted to arid conditions and is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value.
